discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
A is excluded, does not makes sense.
Defenders are deployed via daemon set. Remove Defenders without removing deamon set will recreate agin. So C is excluded.

Selected Answer: BC
C --> Delete the Defender DaemonSet. Generate a defender.yaml file. Deploy the Defender DaemonSet.
B --> For excluson


https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/upgrade/upgrade_defender_daemonset

Selected Answer: CD
C, D - Correct!

choices.C: Remove Defenders, and then deploy the new DaemonSet so Defenders do not have to automatically update on each deployment.
choices.B: Remove Defenders DaemonSet, and then use Cloud Discovery to automatically redeploy the Defenders.
choices.A: Run the provided curl | bash script from Console to remove Defenders, and then use Cloud Discovery to automatically redeploy Defenders.

questions.question_text: Which two options may be used to upgrade the Defenders with a Console v20.04 and Kubernetes deployment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct!

choices.D: Use Lambda layers to deploy a Defender into the function.

discussion.content:

C is the good option

Configure Prisma Cloud to periodically scan your serverless functions. Unlike image scanning, all function scanning is handled by Console.

Which three steps are involved in onboarding an account for Data Security? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Create a Cloudtrail with SNS Topic
choices.A: Create a read-only role with in-line policies

comments.content:

D. Enter the RoleARN and SNSARN
E. Create an S3 bucket

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
B. Create a CloudTrail with SNS Topic
D. Enter the RoleARN and SNSARN
E. Create an S3 bucket

Selected Answer: B
Prisma Cloud Enterprise is CSPM + CWP but Prisma Cloud Compute API Ref doesn't exist anymore

Selected Answer: B
B --> Prisma Cloud API Reference

Prisma Cloud has a REST API that enables you to access Prisma Cloud features programmatically. Most actions supported on the Prisma Cloud web interface are available with the REST API, refer to the Prisma Cloud REST API Reference for details about the REST API.
https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/
B. Prisma Cloud API Reference

B
The Prisma Cloud API allows you to programmatically access and manage your Prisma Cloud resources, making it easy to automate tasks.
(https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/)

Selected Answer: B
"Prisma Cloud Enterprise", so not "Compute" and "programmatically", so API reference
